items.title: X To Test Country-Of-Origin Labels And Account Transparency Features
items.summary:
Elon Musk-owned social media platform X will be internally testing new transparency tools that reveal more details about user accounts, including their country of origin. The initiative, led by X’s Head of Product Nikita Bier, aims to help users better assess the credibility and authenticity of accounts, particularly as bots and anonymous operators become more […]

items.title: Boil smarter in this Govee electric gooseneck kettle with app and voice controls at a $54 low (Reg. up to $80), more from $34
items.summary:
Through its official Amazon storefront, Govee is offering its Smart Electric Gooseneck Kettle for $54.37 shipped. While Amazon lists it with an $80 MSRP, it’s been staying at $64 when in full since July. Prices have previously gone as low as $54 this year, with last week’s Prime Day event only dropping the costs to $60. Now, you can pick it up with more savings than ever (albeit $0.01 lower), letting you upgrade your morning joe routine with $26 off its MSRP for the best price tracked in its history. Head below for more on this and the other Govee kitchen gadgets currently seeing discounts.

items.summary:
If you pop in on Anker’s official Amazon storefront, you can currently pick up the new SOLIX C1000 Gen 2 Portable Power Station at $429 shipped, which beats out the brand’s direct website by $70. We saw this new backup power solution fall to a new $379 low at Amazon during its Prime Day event last week, while the brand’s direct Prime sale only saw it discounted to today’s rate. If you missed out on that two-day all-time low, you can score it at the next-best price while these savings last. Learn more about it by heading below or checking out our hands-on tested review here, while also checking out the early-bird savings on the new SOLIX C2000 Gen 2 power station here.

items.title: Lectric Spooky Sale offers increased savings up to $762 on e-bike bundles with bonus mystery gifts starting from $999
items.summary:
Lectric has launched its Spooky Sale lasting only a week that is increasing savings on e-bike bundles up to $762 while also offering two FREE mystery gifts on select models. Among this event’s bunch, we’re seeing this special Halloween promotion included with the XP4 750 Long-Range Folding Utility e-bikes at $1,299 shipped, which come with up to $514 in FREE bundled gear and the mystery gifts. You’d be paying $1,693 to $1,813 for these bundles at full price, depending on which colorways/frame you choose. The brand’s Labor Day Sale saw the largest previous bundles ($404) on this new model since releasing in May, which is getting beaten out by the Stratus White and Raindrop Blue Step-Thru models’ packages of $514, while the others are getting $394 bundles. You’ll also find its standard XP4 counterparts getting $79 bundles at $999 shipped. Find out more about this e-bike below or by reading our hands-on review here.

items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find the official Baseus storefront offering its 120W 6-port charging station for $29.99 shipped. Don’t forget to enter promo code 8YNI776K during checkout to see the discounted price. This new model recently hit the scene carrying a $50 price tag. It dropped to $40 shortly after its debut, but today’s deal shaves an additional $10 off to mark a new best price to beat. Alternatively, you can even get this 6-port charger for FREE when you buy the brand’s 140W 5-in-1 Nomos charging station with a Qi2-certified wireless charger. Simply head to this link right here and add both the 140W and 120W units from the “Qualifying” and “Benefit” sections to your cart and checkout. This charging unit is good to have on our desk for powering multiple devices simultaneously, and you can learn more about it in detail below.

You’ll find the 4.9-foot model down at $79.99 shipped, while its larger 9.8-foot model is going for $179.99 shipped and its 14.8-foot model drops to $339.99 shipped, after clipping the on-page coupon. These models usually fetch $150, $260, and $400 at full price, respectively, with discounts being more frequent on the former two, while this is a rarer discount on the latter. You’re saving up to 47% here while these deals last, cutting $70/$80/$60 off the going rates for the best prices we have tracked. You can also shop more of the brand’s smart lighting devices – both for indoors and outdoors – by browsing through the brand’s official storefront here.
